questions.question_text: What Investigate tool would you use to allow an analyst to view all events for a specific host?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Host Timeline

questions.question_text: What do you click to jump to a Process Timeline from many pages in Falcon, such as a Hash Search?

choices.B: Process ID or Parent Process ID

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Process ID or Parent Process ID

questions.question_text: What elements are required to properly execute a Process Timeline?

choices.A: Agent ID (AID) and Target Process ID

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Agent ID (AID) and Target Process ID

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
Having both the Agent ID (AID) and the Target Process ID allows CrowdStrike to identify the specific host and the process you want to investigate, enabling the generation of a detailed Process Timeline for that particular process on the specified host.

Selected Answer: A
only the following options are available in the console Agent ID (aid) and Target Process ID (decimal)

questions.question_text: What is the difference between a Host Search and a Host Timeline?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer B
B. A Host Search organizes the data in useful event categories like process executions and network connections; a Host Timeline provides an uncategorized view of recorded events in chronological order

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

Selected Answer: B
A Host Search allows you to organize and filter data based on specific event categories, making it easier to investigate and identify specific events related to your search criteria.
A Host Timeline provides a chronological view of recorded events without categorization, allowing you to see all events in the order they occurred, which can be useful for understanding the sequence of activities on a host.

Selected Answer: B
I think B

choices.B: A Host Search organizes the data in useful event categories like process executions and network connections; a Host Timeline provides an uncategorized view of recorded events in chronological order
choices.C: You access a Host Search from a detection to show you every recorded process event related to the detection and you can only populate the Host Timeline fields manually
choices.D: There is no difference. You just get to them different ways
choices.A: Host Search is used for detection investigation and Host Timeline is used for proactive hunting

choices.D: Local prevalence, IOC Management action, and Event Search
choices.B: File name, path, Local and Global prevalence within the environment
choices.A: VirusTotal, Hybrid Analysis, and Google pivot indicator lights enabled
choices.C: File path, hard disk volume number, and IOC Management action

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Falcon detected the above file attempting to execute. At initial glance, what indicators can we use to provide an initial analysis of the file?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. File name, path, Local and Global prevalence within the environment

The all information was shown on the photo

Selected Answer: B
The most informative indicators for initial file analysis after a Falcon detection are:

B. File name, path, Local and Global prevalence within the environment

Selected Answer: B
the initial analysis typically starts with the file's name, path, and prevalence within your environment.
